title: 110_hr5822
content: SECTION 1. WAIVER OF 10 PERCENT PENALTY ON WITHDRAWALS FROM QUALIFIED RETIREMENT PLANS UPON RECEIPT OF NOTICE OF FORECLOSURE ON A PRINCIPAL RESIDENCE. In response to foreclosure on a principal residence, qualified foreclosure distributions are exempt from the 10 percent additional tax on early distributions from qualified retirement plans. Qualified foreclosure distributions are payments received by an individual after receiving a foreclosure notice on their principal residence. These distributions are exempt from the 10 percent additional tax on early distributions from qualified retirement plans. The maximum amount that can be treated as a qualified foreclosure distribution is $30,000. Qualified foreclosure distributions allow individuals to receive up to $30,000 without incurring the 10 percent additional tax on early retirement plan distributions. Recipients have a 5-year period to repay the distributed amount to an eligible retirement plan. The taxpayer can make a rollover contribution from a qualified foreclosure distribution to certain eligible retirement plans without incurring additional taxes. Repayments from eligible retirement plans other than IRAs will be treated as if the contribution was made. The taxpayer can make a rollover contribution from a qualified foreclosure distribution to eligible retirement plans without extra taxes. Repayments for distributions from IRAs are treated as if the contribution was made. A qualified foreclosure distribution can be treated as a distribution under section 408(d)(3) if contributed to an eligible retirement plan within 60 days. The income inclusion from this distribution can be spread over a 5-year period unless the taxpayer elects otherwise. Qualified foreclosure distributions can be included ratably over a 5-year period unless the taxpayer elects otherwise. Special rules exempt these distributions from trustee to trustee transfer and withholding rules. Qualified foreclosure distributions are treated as meeting plan distribution requirements under certain sections of the tax code. The amendments made by this section will take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.
